documents.title: sharp-eyed quarry worker finds woolly mammoth tusk
text: a woolly mammoth tusk that is around 50,000 years old has been found in a quarry in south worcestershire .
workers at clifton quarry discovered the tusk almost completely intact .
rob hedge , who 's part of the county 's archaeology team , said the tusk only survived in such good condition thanks to the sharp eyes of one on the workers in the quarry .
incredibly one of the machine operators had spotted something deep down in the quarry and recognised it as something significant .
he told his managers , who shut the quarry down and told us . ''

two teenagers approached the man as he was getting into his car , and one kicked the bonnet before assaulting him , police say .

documents.title: suspended sentences for sisters after sex offences
text: two sisters from kington have been given suspended sentences for sexual offences against a young boy .
juliane fellows , 30 , llewellin road , kington , was given a 24-month suspended sentence after being found guilty of gross indecency and sexual activity with a child .

jennifer fellows , 32 , from hatton gardens in kington , was given a 12-month suspended sentence after pleading guilty of indecent assault , and inciting a boy aged between 13 and 17 to sexual activity .
worcester crown court ordered them to be put on the sex offenders register for the next 10 years .

documents.title: rio : mysterious trophies , bikini wax ban and diving over the line
text: if you 're anything like me , you 're already looking forward to this weekend 's olym especially those events involving local competitors such as birchfield harrier matthew hudson-smith who is due to run in the men 's 4x400m team relay on saturday .
then there 's a pair of west midlanders for team gb 's women 's hockey squad - who battle it out for gold in tonight 's final .
but what about the lesser-spotted oddities of the games ?
news takes a look at the quirkier side of competition , from `` bored-looking '' lifeguards overseeing green pools to a ban on `` toilet fishing '' .
and if that 's not enough , take a look at the headline above- talk about a close shave , or not , as the case may be .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'a real disrespect to the paralympic games ' - sir chris holmes
text: a former paralympic swimmer from kidderminster who helped organise the london 2012 games , says the chaos around this year 's games is `` desperately disappointing '' .
sir chris holmes says up to 20 paralym are waiting to see if they will get the promised travel grants to the event , and only 12 % of the seats have been sold .
it 's clear to see that the paralym have n't been given the same priority as the olym and what we 're seeing now is just a real disrespect to the paralympic games . ''

documents.title: gulls 'not dangerous at all ' - urban wildlife expert
text: an urban nature expert has spoken out in defence of gulls , following reports of the birds swooping on residents in worcester .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: blog : why herefordshire fields are vulnerable to being washed away
text: a blog by the environment agency 's dave throup , called keeping herefordshire 's soil where it belongs , explains why so-called soil washing is such a problem in the county .
he says the fine red soils which give the county its landscape character are easily washed away by heavy rain and the undulating terrain means it can move quickly and over long distances .

documents.title: some items stolen from police recovered , but not all
text: some of the items stolen from police forces in the west midlands have been recovered over the past five years .
when thieves made off with a blue flashing lamp , officers in warwickshire managed to get it back .
but cops in our region have n't always been so lucky .
when four horses were pinched from west mercia police the thieves got away scot-free .
whether items were retrieved or not , some people are already asking whether the boys and girls in blue need to be a little more careful with their own property .
author: Tom Turrell
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: items stolen from police : 'how on earth could all this property go missing ? '
text: nine bikes from the west midlands force , a sat nav in west merica and a lap top in staffordshire are among the items stolen from police across the region .
they are bound to raise an eyebrow among many .
their value ranges from a few pounds to tens of thousands of pounds .
`` but , '' i hear you ask , `` how on earth could all this property go missing from under the noses of officers ? ''
in the case of the £ 113,000 stolen from within the bowels of the warwickshire force hq , the answer is , despite a court hearing , nobody knows .
you can see more on this story on midlands today , bbc one , at 13:30 and 18:30 .

BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: paralympic grants chaos `` a real stain on the organising committee ''
text: a former paralympian from kidderminster says the way the games have been organised in rio is a desperate situation .
at the moment , only 12 % of tickets have been sold , compared with the packed stands seen at london 2012 .
sir chris holmes was the director of london 2012 and says the organisers this time around have a lot to answer for .
as we stand today we are facing possibly 29 nations not being able to go to the paralym 2016 because their travel grants have n't been paid - this is a real stain on the organising committee . ''

documents.title: vehicles and horses stolen from police
text: emergency vehicles , dustbins , horses , a barbeque and garden gates are just a few of the items to be stolen from west mercia police .
the items were all taken from officers on the beat or from police stations , according to data obtained by a bbc freedom of information request .
in all , police forces in the west midlands had more than £ 100,000 in cash stolen in the last five years .
items stolen from other forces in the region include cannabis plants , handcuffs and laptops .

documents.title: last chance to surrender illegal knives
text: it 's the last day of a knife amnesty at police stations in worcester , hereford , redditch and kidderminster .
the surrendered weapons , left in special bins , are to be turned into a giant memorial sculpture to honour those who 've been killed by knives .
the sale of so called `` zombie knives '' has been banned across england and wales .

documents.title: watch : baby born with no heartbeat saved by being 'frozen '
text: a baby girl born with no heartbeat was put into total body hypothermia to save her live .
willow rose forrest did n't have a heart beat for the first eight minutes of her life .
her parents , bex and martin , tell how a specialist team from bristol , then delivered a revolutionary treatment that cooled her body to prevent brain damage .
willow is now 16 months old - her parents are fundraising for the charity cots for tots , which provides accommodation for parents at bristol children 's hospital .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: new head for struggling hospital trust
text: one of the top jobs at the trust that runs worcetershire 's hospitals has been filled .
caragh merrick has been appointed as the new chair of worcestershire acute hospitals nhs trust .
she arrives at a critical time for the organisation .
the trust was placed into special measures after being rated inadequate in an inspection last year , and is running a budget deficit of tens of millions of pounds a year .
author: Matthew Bone
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: iraq war crowd funding appeal raises £ 160k
text: a crowd funding appeal by a worcestershire campaigner has raised £ 160,000 in month , which he says he will use to hire lawyers to investigate tony blair 's conduct relating to the iraq war .

reg keys , whose son died in the conflict , says lawyers will now begin examining the chilcot report to see if there 's enough evidence to bring a civil prosecution against the former prime minister .
l/cpl thomas keys was 20 when he died in iraq in 2003 .
the crowd funding appeal closes tonight .
hopefully we will be able to take a civil action against any state official , including tony blair , [ if they ] acted unlawfully or in excess of their powers . ''

the pass rate of 98.1 % remained the same .

worthington 's actions had clearly left him feeling vulnerable and exposed . ''

documents.title: dog rescued from a woof : spaniel coaxed off house
text: a dog was rescued from the roof of a house after climbing out of a velux window while her owners were on holiday .
wythall animal sanctuary was contacted by a concerned pet sitter after the eight-year-old dog springer spaniel called millie got stuck on the roof of a house in hollywood in bromsgrove .

the dog 's owners were due back on holiday that same day and `` as you can imagine were rather surprised at seeing a of their dog sat on their roof when they had just stepped off a plane , '' say the charity .
we managed to lean out the velux window put the catch pole loop around her neck , secure it and pull her in through the window .
afterwards , 8 year old millie had a long drink and seemed rather pleased with her antics .
author: Stephanie Barnard

documents.title: breakingfour arrests in connection with father 's day death
text: four people from hereford have been arrested in connection with the death of christian bagley ( died in the city on father 's day last year .
west mercia police say two men , aged 27 and 36 , have been arrested on sus of murder and remain in police custody at this time .
two women , aged 34 and 51 , were also arrested on sus of assisting an offender and conspiracy to pervert the course of justice .
they have both released on bail , police say .

documents.title: pershore plums helped win ww1 claims new book
text: a new book reveals that pershore 's plum crop was so important that belgian refugees , german prisoners of war and irish workers were brought in to help with the harvest .
how the pershore plum won the great war reveals the army bought up the plum crop while it was still on the trees to be turned into jam for troops at the front .
the book also tells how the women 's institute was founded to help housewives produce , prepare and preserve food for their families .

it is the result of a two-year collaboration between university of worcester students , academics and heritage lottery funded projects carried out by pershore 's women 's institute and heritage and history centre .
soldiers needed calories .
it was the ability to feed troops and people at home , so soldiers did n't get letters saying 'we 're starving ' which was vital for morale and kept the british fighting to the bitter end . ''

documents.title: fresh hope for woman in coma after motorway crash
text: a herefordshire law graduate , who was in a coma for 19 days after sustaining horrific injuries in a car crash , has spoken her first words .
sam hemming , 22 , received a serious head injury in the crash on the m6 in july and broke four bones in her neck , had three open fractures on her arm , as well as having internal bleeding .
her friend aimee boyd has set up a go fund me page to raise money towards specialist equipment to care for sam , who she says has beaten the odds to speak again .
she actually spoke , which is massive because her parents were told she would never speak again .

the nurse said good morning and she said 'yes ' , and she asked if she was in any pain and she said 'no ' , which is really great because it shows she knows who she is and is using words which are conscious responses . ''

documents.title: campaigner claims dive-bombing seagull problem with get worse

the latest figures show the number of breeding pairs in worcester went down from 201 in 2014 to 181 last year .
people should be able to sit outside and eat .
i think the problem started with fast food and people eating on the street and now the seagulls just dive bomb people in the street .
i can see the problem getting worse as the years go by . ''

documents.title: solicitors closed after 'dishonesty ' by manager
text: a law firm in worcester has been ordered to close by the solicitors regulation authority ( sra ) because there is `` reason to suspect dishonesty on the part of the manager '' .
the sra said diane lee , the manager of simply solicitors had failed to comply with its principles and accounts rules .
the watchdog said it took the decision to intervene because it felt it had to `` protect the interests of clients ( or former or potential clients ) of the firm '' .
in a statement ms lee said the returns she had submitted were drafts , while she awaited further information .
she said she was `` disappointed '' with the sra decision because she was currently off work sick , but would have been `` more than willing to deal with any queries '' once well enough .
`` i made the decision to cease trading myself in june / july 2016 to enable me to concentrate on the legal issues , '' she added .

documents.title: last chance to see historic fountain in action before refurbishment
text: this weekend is the last time visitors to witley court in worcestershire can see the historic perseus and andromeda fountain in action before the start of major refurbishment work .
the victorian fountain has 120 jets hidden among sculptures of shells , sea nymphs , dolphins and a huge serpent , and was designed by james forsyth and built in portland stone .
english heritage says restoration work should finish by april next year .
the grade i listed witley court has been a ruin since a fire in 1937 .

documents.title: fire service warns of open water dangers
text: a warning about the dangers of swimming in open water has been issued by the fire service as temperatures look set to soar to 25c ( 77f ) .
hereford & worcester fire and rescue service is warning that even the strongest swimmers can find themselves in difficulty , as the cold water causes muscles to cramp .
there is then a strong possibility that they can not swim due to muscular cramps which can then lead to drowning , whatever their age .
we would like to encourage people to take extra care . ''

documents.title: 'constructive ' meeting over new stadium for worcester city
text: a working party looking at finding a site for a new stadium for worcester city has held `` another constructive meeting '' , the council says .
the club has been without a home in the city since it sold its st george 's lane site for housing in 2013 .
the club played at aggborough , the home of kidderminster harriers , and is now ground sharing with bromsgrove sporting .
the meeting was attended by colin layland , vice chairman of worcester city football club , and mark newell of the club 's supporters trust .

documents.title: date set for closure of children 's beds at alexandra hospital
text: there will no longer be inpatient children 's beds at alexandra hospital in redditch from 7 september , the trust running worcestershire 's hospitals has announced .

worcestershire acute hospitals nhs trust says that due to `` a lack of specialist doctors '' the children 's ward at the site will be closed and the doctors and nurses will move to worcestershire royal hospital .

documents.title: star wars fan using force of internet to help grant last wish
text: a hos caring for a star wars fan has launched a facebook campaign to help him see the new film before its december release .

neil hanvey , a patient at herefordshire 's st michael 's hos may not live until christmas , but nurse amy duncan and his family and friends are hoping he can see an advance screening of rogue one : a star wars story .
last year , lucasfilm granted a similar wish for a cancer patient in america .
ms duncan told bbc hereford and worcester the appeal had so far had 1,300 re-posts .
at first i was n't really sure [ it could succeed ] but as time 's gone on it 's become more of a reality - i 'm amazed by the response i 've had . ''

was arrested on 12 august .
a 27-year-old woman and a 37-year-old man , both from hereford , were arrested on 28 may .

text: a man who died after being tasered by west mercia police in telford is believed to be former footballer dalian atkinson .
police were called to a house at around 1:30 this morning after concerns for the safety of a man .
a taser was used on the 48-year-old man and after receiving medical help , he was pronounced dead at about 03:00 .
mr atkinson played for aston villa , ipswich town and sheffield wednesday .
during a 16-year career , he also played for real sociedad and fenerbahce , winning one cap for england b .

the trust acknowledge barbara sunpter 's care was `` not ideal '' and say they are `` working hard to improve '' .
they say major building work is currently under way to expand the a & e department at worcestershire royal so they can provide a better environment for patients .

documents.title: taster death : west mercia pcc says important to hold police to account
text: west mercia police and crime commissioner john campion says he will make sure the police are held to account if needed over the death of a man after being tasered by officers .
police were called to telford in the early hours of this morning to an incident involving a 48-year-old man .
he died shortly after arriving at hospital .
mr campion said an independent investigation is now under way with the independent police complaints commission and his thoughts are with the man 's family .
it is an important part of my role to hold the police to account .
i want to be absolutely clear and reassure our communities that i will be doing that fairly and proportionately with regard to this incident once the full facts are available . ''

documents.title: hereford gp due before tribunal for misconduct charges
text: a gp from hereford is due before a tribunal in manchester today to face charges of misconduct .

dr allen is also accused of keeping blood test results secret and not communicating with the patient 's own gp .
he 's also accused of issuing a prescription in his wife 's name for a patient .
the tribunal is listed for eight days .

documents.title: travel : lane closed on m5
text: one lane 's closed southbound on the m5 near wychbold , between j5 for the a38 and j6 for the a449/a440 .
it 's due to a broken-down lorry .
traffic is running slow .

author: BBC Travel
